sentences.en: After breast - feed, mom should feed a morsel of water to clean mouth.
sentences.cn: 每次喂完奶之后要再喂一两口清水,以清洁口腔.

sentences.en: Between the cup and the lip a morsel may slip.
But she could hardly get down a morsel.
sentences.cn: 但她简直连一口也吃不下去.

sentences.en: He ate every savoury morsel of a delectable stew at the dinner.
sentences.cn: 晚餐时他吃遍每一道味美可口的炖食.

sentences.en: He had a morsel of food caught between one tooth and another.
sentences.cn: 他的齿缝里嵌进了一小片食物.

sentences.en: He refused to touch a morsel of the food they had brought.
sentences.cn: 他们拿来的东西他一口也不吃.

sentences.en: I was no more to her than a morsel of scoff in the fuel - house.
sentences.cn: 我在她的眼里还不如柴房里的一小堆木屑.

sentences.en: In their eyes I was an even tastier morsel than Mama . I could see it.
sentences.cn: 我在他们的眼中是更解馋的, 我看出来.

sentences.en: MORSEL : A pair of good ears will drinka hundred tongues.
sentences.cn: 箴言一对好的耳朵什么话都能听.

sentences.en: Ray was so hungry that he enjoyed every morsel of the stale bread.
sentences.cn: 瑞因太饥饿了,所以津津有味地吃每一口干硬的面包.

sentences.en: The poor morsel of food only whetted desire.
sentences.cn: 那块小的可怜的喜糕反而激起了他们的食欲.

sentences.en: What will you take yourself, miss? You'll take a morsel of something?
sentences.cn: 你想吃点什么吗, 小姐? 吃一点好不好?

sentences.en: You have a morsel of chocolate in your mouth, right?
sentences.cn: 你的嘴?有一颗巧克力, 对不对?

sentences.en: You look like a tasty morsel to me.
sentences.cn: 你看起来象可口的小食.

trans.tran_cn: 一口，（尤指食物）小块，碎屑
trans.tran_en: A morsel is a very small amount of something, especially a very small piece of food
